author: Reuters
title: Israeli tanks, missiles strike Gaza in offensive against Hamas By Reuters
text:
© Reuters. Israeli soldiers work to repair tanks amid the ongoing conflict between Israel and the Palestinian Islamist group Hamas, near the Israel-Gaza border, in southern Israel, December 28, 2023. REUTERS/Amir Cohen By Nidal al-Mughrabi and Bassam Masoud
CAIRO/GAZA (Reuters) - Israeli forces attacked areas of the central and southern Gaza Strip where residents have been expecting a renewed ground offensive in areas crammed with tens of thousands of Palestinians already displaced by the Israeli-Hamas war.
With nightfall on Thursday, an Israeli airstrike on a house in the southern city of Khan Younis killed eight Palestinians, health officials said. Three Palestinians were killed and six injured in an Israeli missile strike on a house in Maghazi camp in central Gaza, the Palestine Red Crescent said.
"The task here is to dismantle Hamas - so that it no longer has military and governing capabilities," Israeli Defence Minister Yoav Gallant said at a press briefing on operations in Khan Younis. "We will be required to show a lot of perseverance and determination."
A Palestinian journalist posted pictures of Israeli tanks near a mosque in a built-up area of Bureij in central Gaza.
The Islamist group Hamas released video it said showed its fighters targeting Israeli tanks and soldiers east of Bureij. Reuters was not able to verify the location or the date the video was filmed.
"That moment has come, I wished it would never happen, but it seems displacement is a must," said Omar, 60, who said he had been forced to move with at least 35 family members. He declined to give his surname for fear of reprisals.
Yamen Hamad has been living in a school in Deir al-Balah, also in central Gaza, since fleeing from the north. He said people newly displaced from Bureij and Nusseirat were setting up tents wherever there was open ground.
In one of Israel's latest airstrikes, 20 Palestinians were killed and 55 wounded in Rafah, a major town near the southern border with Egypt, Gaza health ministry spokesman Ashraf Al-Qidra said. Their bombed building was housing displaced civilians, according to local medics and residents.
SEARCHING THROUGH RUBBLE
Reuters video showed rescuers scrabbling frantically through rubble to uncover and pull out victims including a baby and several children and rushing them through milling crowds of dazed and weeping people to the nearby Kuwaiti Hospital.
Palestinian health authorities said earlier that 210 people were confirmed killed in Israeli strikes in the past 24 hours, raising the toll of Palestinians killed in the war so far to 21,320 - nearly 1% of Gaza's population. Thousands more dead were feared to be buried or lost in the ruins.
Over the course of the war, the Israeli military has expressed regret for civilian deaths but it accuses Hamas of operating in densely populated areas and using civilians as human shields, a charge the group denies.
Hamas and its fighters are dug deep into the Gaza Strip's dense cities and towns and their leaders are still at large.
Israel has reported 169 of its soldiers killed in its Gaza campaign after Hamas fighters rampaged through Israeli towns in a cross-border raid on Oct. 7, killing 1,200 people and taking about 240 hostages.
Some 110 hostages were freed during a Nov. 24-Dec. 1 humanitarian pause and more than 20 others have been declared dead.
U.S. President Joe Biden said on Thursday that Hamas killed an American hostage, Judith Weinstein, 70, on Oct. 7. Last week he said her husband Gadi Haggai, 73, was killed on the same day.
The Israeli military released findings of an investigation into the killings in error by its troops of three Israeli hostages in Gaza on Dec. 15. Soldiers mistook their cries for help as a ruse by Hamas militants to draw them into an ambush, the military said, concluding that the soldiers acted rightly to the best of their understanding.
EGYPT'S PLAN TO END CONFLICT
Egypt confirmed on Thursday that it had put forward a framework proposal to end the conflict between Israel and Hamas in the Gaza Strip that includes three stages ending with a ceasefire and said it was awaiting responses on the plan.
The proposal is an attempt "to bring viewpoints between all concerned parties closer, in an effort to stop Palestinian bloodshed and the aggression against the Gaza Strip and restore peace and stability to the region," Diaa Rashwan, head of Egypt's State Information Service, said in a statement.
Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has said Israel will keep some form of security control of all Gaza indefinitely, though he insists that this would not amount to reoccupying the enclave.
Israeli tanks, missiles strike Gaza in offensive against Hamas

author: José Miguel Velázquez
title: Secretaría de Salud alerta sobre aumento de casos de sarampión, México registra 7 casos
text:
México ha registrado mil 871 casos sospechosos de sarampión en lo que va del año, pero sólo siete casos han sido confirmados, todos vinculados a contagios importados. Entre el 1 de enero y el 8 de diciembre de 2024, los siete pacientes que contrajeron el [virus](https://heraldodemexico.com.mx/mundo/2024/12/18/california-declara-estado-de-emergencia-por-gripe-aviar-h5n1-hay-riesgo-para-mexico-662575.html) en el país fueron contagiados por personas que lo trajeron de otras regiones, principalmente de Europa, donde se ha registrado un aumento significativo de casos en los últimos años.
Ante este escenario, la [Secretaría de Salud ](https://heraldodemexico.com.mx/nacional/2024/12/12/gobierno-federal-secretaria-de-salud-llevaran-medicos-analisis-clinicos-hasta-los-hogares-de-mexico-660999.html)(Ssa), a través de la Dirección General de Epidemiología (DGE), ha emitido un aviso epidemiológico con el objetivo de prevenir la introducción del sarampión en México y proteger a la población de un posible brote.
Incremento de sarampión en el continente americano
El Comité Nacional para la Vigilancia Epidemiológica (CONAVE), en coordinación con la Organización Mundial de la Salud (OMS) y la Organización Panamericana de la Salud (OPS), alertó sobre el incremento de casos de sarampión en las Américas. A pesar de los esfuerzos de vacunación en la región, el aumento global del sarampión es preocupante.
El doctor Alberto Medina Chanona, director del Centro de Vacunación Familiar, destacó que estos casos importados son un recordatorio de lo que puede ocurrir si se interrumpen los esfuerzos de inmunización. "En 2016, las Américas fueron declaradas libres de sarampión gracias a la vacunación", indicó el experto, subrayando la importancia de seguir las políticas de inmunización para evitar el regreso de enfermedades que se creían erradicadas.
Registran casos en Europa
Desde 1995, México no ha tenido casos autóctonos de sarampión, pero el virus ha comenzado a reemerger en países de Europa y Asia, que en 2022 reportaron un aumento alarmante de 3 mil por ciento en los casos. Este fenómeno se debió a la falta de acceso a vacunas durante la pandemia de COVID-19 y a situaciones de conflicto bélico.
En México, la última gran epidemia de sarampión ocurrió a finales de la década de 1980, con 89 mil casos confirmados. La clave para evitar un retroceso en el control de la enfermedad ha sido la implementación de programas de vacunación eficientes, que comenzaron en 1970.
El sarampión, enfermedad altamente contagiosa, puede causar la muerte de entre el 10 por ciento y el 15 por ciento de los menores que lo padecen. El doctor Medina Chanona enfatizó que, para protegerse, la vacuna sigue siendo la forma más efectiva, con una efectividad superior al 90 por ciento. Por ello, es urgente acelerar los procesos de vacunación para asegurar que tanto niños como adultos estén protegidos y evitar la reintroducción de esta enfermedad.
Sigue leyendo:
[¿Cuál es el origen de la enfermedad desconocida en Congo? OMS baraja posible virus mortal](https://heraldodemexico.com.mx/mundo/2024/12/7/cual-es-el-origen-de-la-enfermedad-desconocida-en-congo-oms-baraja-posible-virus-mortal-659769.html)
[Chiapas suma 10 decesos por dengue en lo que va del año](https://heraldodemexico.com.mx/nacional/2024/12/11/chiapas-suma-10-decesos-por-dengue-en-lo-que-va-del-ano-660842.html)
El gobierno ha implementado un plan para contener la enfermedad que se ha presentado en el est
DRV

author: 来源： Aibase基地
title: 苹果智能家居中心再度延期至2026年中期，全新Siri成核心亮点
text:
据知名苹果分析师马克·古尔曼（Mark Gurman）透露，苹果正在开发的类似iPad的智能家居中心设备将推迟至2026年中期才会正式发布。古尔曼此前预测该设备最早将于2025年推出，但由于Apple Intelligence版Siri出现技术问题而被反复推迟。
外观设计类似Google Nest Hub，功能更加丰富
据透露，这款智能家居中心将配备内置7英寸显示屏和扬声器系统，整体外观与Google Nest Hub相似。古尔曼将其形容为"正方形外观"，采用黑色或白色窄边框设计，配有圆角和半圆顶底座，体现了苹果一贯的简约设计风格。
该设备代号为J490，将运行代号为"Charismatic"的全新操作系统。与现有的iOS、macOS和tvOS不同，Charismatic专为家庭多位成员共同使用而设计。其用户界面以钟面显示和Apple应用小组件为核心，并可能搭载具有虚拟形象的Siri界面，让Siri的外观更加个性化。据悉，苹果正在测试一种类似Mac Finder图标的Siri视觉形象。
人脸识别实现个性化体验
该智能家居中心的前置摄像头将具备人脸扫描功能，当用户靠近时自动识别身份，并为每个家庭成员提供专属的内容和功能。这一设计理念体现了苹果对个性化用户体验的重视。
值得注意的是，该设备不会拥有专门的App Store，但可以运行日历、相机、音乐、提醒事项和备忘录等原生Apple应用。苹果预计用户主要通过语音命令控制智能家居中心，尽管设备配备了触摸屏作为辅助操作方式。
LLM驱动的全新Siri成技术核心
Siri将成为这款智能家居中心的核心功能，苹果正在开发基于大型语言模型驱动的全新Siri版本。苹果希望新版Siri能够深度整合用户个人数据，为用户提供更加丰富和智能的交互体验。
这一功能最初计划包含在iOS18中，但现在将以扩展的LLM版本形式推出。古尔曼透露，苹果可能准备"最早在明年春天"推出LLM版本的Siri。同时，适用于iPhone和iPad的全新视觉设计版Siri也可能在2026年某个时候发布。
技术路线仍在探索，多方案并行开发
目前，苹果正在同时测试两种不同的技术路线:一种基于其内部AI模型的LLM版Siri，另一种则使用OpenAI和Anthropic等外部公司的技术。苹果尚未最终决定采用哪种技术方案，这种多方案并行的策略体现了公司对技术选择的谨慎态度。
为未来产品奠定基础
值得关注的是，Charismatic操作系统和新版Siri不仅将应用于智能家居中心，还将成为苹果正在研发的独立桌面机器人的技术基础。据古尔曼透露，这款桌面机器人计划于2027年推出，这表明苹果正在构建一个完整的智能家居生态系统。
苹果代码中已经发现了对J490设备的相关引用，这证实了该产品确实处于积极开发阶段。虽然发布时间有所推迟，但这款智能家居中心有望为苹果在智能家居市场的竞争中提供重要支撑。

author: la rédaction avec AFP
title: Niger. Des milliers de personnes ont célébré le départ des militaires français
text: Niger Des milliers de personnes ont célébré le départ des militaires français Des milliers de personnes ont célébré ce vendredi le départ, il y a une semaine, des derniers militaires français déployés au Niger, pays dirigé par un régime militaire depuis le coup d’État du 26 juillet, en présence des Premiers ministres nigérien, burkinabé et malien. Concerts, spectacles d'acrobates, slogans anti-français... plusieurs milliers de personnes ont célébré ce vendredi [ le départ, il y a une semaine, des derniers militaires français déployés au Niger](/defense-guerre-conflit/2023/12/22/pres-de-cinq-mois-apres-le-coup-d-etat-le-retrait-des-troupes-francaises-s-acheve).Ce rassemblement « marque la fin » des « sit-in » commencés « le 2 septembre devant la base » aérienne de Niamey, répétés « jusqu'au départ des forces françaises », a expliqué Adamou Issa, un membre de la société civile. Les Premiers ministres du Mali et du Burkina Faso Arrivés en fin d'après-midi à Niamey pour une visite de travail de trois jours, les Premiers ministres du Mali, Choguel Maïga et du [Burkina Faso](/politique/2022/09/30/burkina-faso-le-chef-de-la-junte-demis-de-ses-fonctions-les-frontieres-du-pays-fermees), Apollinaire Kyélèm de Tambéla, ont assisté à l'événement aux côtés de leur homologue nigérien, Ali Mahaman Lamine Zeine. Ces deux pays frontaliers du Niger, avec lesquels Niamey a formé l'Alliance des États du Sahel (AES) - une coopération de défense - [sont également dirigés par des militaires issus de coups d’État](/politique/2020/08/19/mali-les-militaires-appellent-a-une-transition-politique-civile-conduisant-a-des-elections). Les trois Premiers ministres sont montés sur un podium et ont salué la foule, avant de partir sans prendre la parole. 1 500 militaires français Suite à la dénonciation par le régime nigérien de plusieurs accords militaires qui reliaient Niamey à Paris, la France a officiellement terminé vendredi dernier le retrait de ses quelque 1 500 militaires, mettant fin à dix ans de lutte antijihadiste française au Sahel. Dans cette région, le Niger était l'un des derniers alliés de Paris avant [ le coup d’État du 26 juillet](/defense-guerre-conflit/2023/07/27/coup-d-etat-par-des-militaires-la-communaute-internationale-s-insurge ) qui a renversé le président élu Mohamed Bazoum. Le Tchad, pays voisin du Niger, abrite toujours le commandement des forces françaises au Sahel.

author: Adnkronos
title: Salute: Urban Vision sostiene la Pigiama Run, uniti contro i tumori infantili
text:
Roma, 19 set. (Adnkronos) – “All?unica corsa in Pigiama d?Italia per sostenere i piccoli pazienti oncologici quest?anno si aggiunge un partner d?eccezione: Urban Vision, creative-tech media company, leader nel Dooh e nel fundraising pubblicitario per la tutela del patrimonio culturale e promozione di iniziative sociali, parteciperà attivamente alla sesta edizione della Pigiama Run, la maratona solidale organizzata dalla Lega Italiana per la Lotta contro i Tumori (Lilt). L?evento si terrà venerdì 20 settembre, nel mese del Gold Ribbon dedicato ai tumori pediatrici, e coinvolgerà migliaia di persone in 40 città italiane”. Si legge in una nota.
“La Pigiama Run non è una gara qualsiasi. È una corsa e camminata in pigiama, simbolo di vicinanza e solidarietà verso i bambini che affrontano la malattia, spesso costretti a trascorrere troppo tempo a letto. E Urban Vision ha deciso di essere in prima linea mettendo a disposizione i suoi circuiti di maxi Dooh per l?amplificazione dell?iniziativa promossa da Lilt”. Spiega Gianluca De Marchi, Ceo e fondatore di Urban Vision. “Partecipare alla Pigiama Run non significa solo correre, ma scendere in campo per un futuro migliore, in cui ogni bambino possa guarire dal cancro. Crediamo nell?importanza di sostenere iniziative sociali di grande impatto stimolando il coinvolgimento delle persone attraverso la comunicazione nelle nostre città, e la Pigiama Run, con la sua energia positiva e il suo messaggio di speranza, è un?occasione per fare la nostra parte utilizzando il contesto urbano per aprire un dialogo con le cittadine e i cittadini sui tumori dei più piccoli e sensibilizzarli a una partecipazione attiva?.
“Animati da spirito di solidarietà i maxi led screen di Urban Vision diffonderanno l?iniziativa a Milano e Roma, amplificando la partecipazione e il sostegno verso la lotta contro i tumori. Non solo schermi, Urban Vision scenderà in campo con un proprio team di corridori solidali, abbracciando lo spirito giocoso e solidale dell?iniziativa”.

author: Jack29a
title: #30 Cómo perder la alcaldía de Pamplona y la reputación en una sola frase
text:
[Osdransky](/user/Osdransky)a [eldiario.es](/go/link/3891544)
La plaza consistorial de Pamplona parece sanfermines en esta moción pero el PP sigue sin entender absolutamente nada!!!!
Idos a tomar por culo!!!!!!!
[#1](c1#c-1) llevan así desde la recogida de firmas para derogar el estatut catalán. Pero que sigan, que sigan.
[#10](c10#c-10) y eso que allí ponen todos los impedimentos posibles para que la gente no vote (sobre todo los grupos poblacionales que no suelen votar a los republicanos).
[#1](c1#c-1) Positivo por el elefante uso del imperativo del verbo ir con el enclético "os". Aunque la real academia admite desde hace años "iros" y todos recordamos con cariño aquel "si me queréis, irse" de la gran Lola no es menos cierto que "Idos a tomar por culo" destila elegancia, clasicismo, ritmo, gracia y donaire en cada sílaba.
[#9](c9#c-9) No hay ningún clasismo, todo lo contrario, está reconociendo la dureza de ese trabajo y el mérito que tiene hacerlo.
Es como si dijera "preferiría trabajar en la mina". Se refiere a la dureza del trabajo.
No va a decir "preferiría trabajar como CEO de un eléctrica", lo cual no suena a trabajo físico duro.
Ningún clasismo, pero lo dice elpanfleto.es, manipulando, y os lo tragáis todo sin masticar. Qué pena. Un poquito de capacidad crítica no os vendría mal, deberíais intentarlo, aunque os cueste, debido a que hay que pensar y eso no es fácil para vosotros. Es más fácil formar parte del rebaño.
Creo que les ha retratado muy bien. Estoy un poco cansado de eldiario pero este artículo es bastante adecuado.
[#0](c0#c-0) gracias
[#2](c2#c-2) Tranquilo, tienen todo el escudo mediático. No lo verás en el telediario de A3, salvo que esa misma frase la hubiera dicho una alcaldesa del PSOE o de SUMAR.
[#5](c5#c-5) Al hilo de lo que dices, hoy he visto las noticias de la noche de A·, con Vicente Vallés, y, en algún momento creía que le iba a dar un infarto: los independentistas, Bildu, traición del PSOE, traición de Sánchez y así así... Uno, si sigue escuchando cree que va a llegar el final de la democracia y el apocalipsis, como mínimo.
[#6](c6#c-6) es indecente lo de ese señor... verlo vomitar bilis de esa manera, da muchisima grima, no se como no le aconseja alguien que se modere un poco
A mí el que me hace gracia es Feijó diciendo que el PSOE ya no es un partido constitucionalista.
Pues no sé, creo que debió quedarse dormido en el artículo 1 porque en el 140 ya te dice de forma general cómo se eligen los concejales y como son éstos los que eligen a un alcalde.
En fin, que habrá quien le compre el discurso, pero no hay por donde cogerlo

author: NewsBreak Original
title: The FDA Recalled More Than 2 Million Cans of Coconut Water Across 29 States
text:
2 hours ago The recall includes 169,438 cases, totaling 2,033,256 cans.
Food & Wine / Getty Images
If you've purchased any coconut water lately, then you may want to check your fridge.
The Food and Drug Administration (FDA) initiated a recall for Jarritos Coconut Water 12-can cartons made by Tipp Distributors, Inc. It then re-upped the recall on Dec. 10 and noted it's ongoing. According to the recall notice, "The hermetic seal on the lid of the cans may be compromised," which can affect the integrity of the product, causing it to leak, or, worse, be contaminated with harmful bacteria that will lead to illness if ingested.
The recalled product was distributed across 29 states, including Alabama, Arkansas, Delaware, Florida, Georgia, Iowa, Illinois, Indiana, Kansas, Kentucky, Louisiana, Massachusetts, Maryland, Michigan, Missouri, Mississippi, North Carolina, Nebraska, New Hampshire, New Jersey, New York, Ohio, Oklahoma, Pennsylvania, South Carolina, Tennessee, Texas, Virginia, and Wisconsin.
The recall includes 169,438 cases, totaling 2,033,256 cans. It includes all lot codes.
As Food Safety News reported, the most dangerous potential outcome is botulism poisoning, which can "paralyze the muscles needed for breathing, resulting in sudden death." It pointed to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) website, which noted that symptoms of botulism poisoning typically set in within 18 to 36 hours after exposure, though symptoms can pop up 10 days later. "The spores usually do not cause people to become sick, even when they're eaten," the CDC explained. "But under certain conditions, these spores can grow and make one of the most lethal toxins known."
Related: Food Recalls Are Happening More Frequently Than Ever — Here’s What Food Safety Experts Want You to Know
The CDC added that "improperly home-canned, preserved, or fermented foods can provide the right conditions for spores to grow and make botulinum toxin," which means a can of coconut water that is also improperly sealed could also have the potential for the toxin to thrive as well. Again, the chances are slim, but it's probably not worth the gamble.
If you've experienced any of these symptoms, you should contact a medical professional immediately. And, if you've purchased the recalled coconut water you should not consume it and either discard it immediately or return it to the point of purchase for a full refund. If you have any additional questions about the recall, you can reach the company's customer service hotline at 1-888-668-2639.
Coconut Water Recall Product: Jarritos Coconut Water 12-can cartons
Number of cans recalled: 2,033,256
Product Codes: All lot codes are included in the recall
Recall reason: The hermetic seal on the can was compromised
States affected: Alabama, Arkansas, Delaware, Florida, Georgia, Iowa, Illinois, Indiana, Kansas, Kentucky, Louisiana, Massachusetts, Maryland, Michigan, Missouri, Mississippi, North Carolina, Nebraska, New Hampshire, New Jersey, New York, Ohio, Oklahoma, Pennsylvania, South Carolina, Tennessee, Texas, Virginia, and Wisconsin

author: Justin Ivey
title: Pam Grier Reveals Why She’s Learning To Pole Dance For Cardi B
text:
Pam Grier decided to pick up a new skill for her proposed movie with Cardi B. The legendary actress said she’s learning how to pole dance for a role in the film on Bravo’s Watch What Happens Live with Andy Cohen .
“I’m doing presently my biopic as a series,” Grier said when asked about the Cardi B collaboration. “As soon as I finish that, I really wanted to work with her. And it could be in maybe two years at the theater ‘cause I’m now learning how to pole dance. And it’s taking a minute, but it’s a lot of fun. But it’s a wonderful story. I don’t want to give it away, but it’s perfect for her because she’s a great mom.”
Grier told Rolling Stone she was writing a script for herself and Cardi B in 2022. The Foxy Brown star refused to disclose any major details about the movie, but she teased her and Cardi B’s roles on Watch What Happens Live .
“I’m the pole dancer,” Grier said. “And she teaches me.”
Cardi B wasn’t the only rapper mentioned during Grier’s appearance on Watch What Happens Live . Grier also discussed Snoop Dogg passing out when he met her for the first time at an airport.
“He was turning pale and he got up and he wobbled to the men’s room.,” Grier recalled. “I said, ‘Is he OK?’ He went in and fell down on the pissy floor and fainted.”
She added, “I was so upset that they cleaned him up and brought him back out and we sat together. I didn’t know I had that effect on him. He’s such a lovely person, I just couldn’t imagine him lying in urine.”
Grier and Snoop Dogg worked together on the 2001 horror film Bones . Snoop Dogg recounted his fainting story in several interviews.
@bravowwhl Pam Grier says we may see her project with Cardi B in two years and she’s learning how to pole dance to prepare. #WWHL
♬ original sound – BravoWWHL
